verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when Adonizedec king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;
verses.ct: When Adonizedec king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had captured Ai and completely destroyed it — doing to Ai and its king exactly what he had done to Jericho and its king — and that the people of Gibeon had made a peace agreement with Israel and were now living among them,

verses.kjv: That they feared greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all the men thereof were mighty.
verses.ct: he and his people were terrified, because Gibeon was a major city, as large as any royal city. It was even bigger than Ai, and all its men were skilled warriors.

verses.kjv: Wherefore Adonizedec king of Jerusalem sent unto Hoham king of Hebron, and unto Piram king of Jarmuth, and unto Japhia king of Lachish, and unto Debir king of Eglon, saying,
verses.ct: So Adonizedec king of Jerusalem sent messages to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish, and Debir king of Eglon, saying,

verses.kjv: Come up unto me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for it hath made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.
verses.ct: "Come join me, and help me attack Gibeon, because they have made peace with Joshua and the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together, and went up, they and all their hosts, and encamped before Gibeon, and made war against it.
verses.ct: So the 5 Amorite kings — the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon — joined forces. They marched up with all their armies, set up positions around Gibeon, and launched an attack against it.

verses.kjv: And the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the mountains are gathered together against us.
verses.ct: The men of Gibeon sent an urgent message to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal: "Don't abandon your servants! Come quickly and rescue us! Help us, because all the Amorite kings from the hill country have united against us."

verses.kjv: So Joshua ascended from Gilgal, he, and all the people of war with him, and all the mighty men of valour.
verses.ct: So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with his entire fighting force, including all his best warriors.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Fear them not: for I have delivered them into thine hand; there shall not a man of them stand before thee.
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid of them. I have given you victory over them. Not one of them will be able to stand against you."

verses.kjv: Joshua therefore came unto them suddenly, and went up from Gilgal all night.
verses.ct: Joshua caught them by surprise after marching all night from Gilgal.

verses.kjv: And the LORD discomfited them before Israel, and slew them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them along the way that goeth up to Bethhoron, and smote them to Azekah, and unto Makkedah.
verses.ct: The LORD threw them into confusion in front of Israel, and Israel inflicted a devastating defeat on them at Gibeon. They chased them along the road going up to Bethhoron and struck them down all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel, and were in the going down to Bethhoron, that the LORD cast down great stones from heaven upon them unto Azekah, and they died: they were more which died with hailstones than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.
verses.ct: As they fled from Israel on the descent from Bethhoron, the LORD hurled massive hailstones down on them from heaven all the way to Azekah, and they died. More of them were killed by the hailstones than by the swords of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.
verses.ct: On the day the LORD gave Israel victory over the Amorites, Joshua spoke to the LORD. Then in front of all Israel he said, "Sun, stop over Gibeon! Moon, stand still over the valley of Ajalon!"

verses.kjv: And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies. Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.
verses.ct: The sun stopped, and the moon stood still, until the nation had taken full vengeance on their enemies. Isn't this recorded in the book of Jasher? The sun stopped in the middle of the heavens and did not set for about an entire day.

verses.kjv: And there was no day like that before it or after it, that the LORD hearkened unto the voice of a man: for the LORD fought for Israel.
verses.ct: There has never been a day like it before or since — a day when the LORD listened to the voice of a human being. The LORD was fighting for Israel.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.

verses.kjv: But these five kings fled, and hid themselves in a cave at Makkedah.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the 5 kings had escaped and hidden themselves in a cave at Makkedah.

verses.kjv: And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.
verses.ct: When Joshua was told, "The 5 kings have been found hiding in a cave at Makkedah,"

verses.kjv: And Joshua said, Roll great stones upon the mouth of the cave, and set men by it for to keep them:
verses.ct: Joshua ordered, "Roll large stones over the entrance of the cave and post guards there to watch over them.

verses.kjv: And stay ye not, but pursue after your enemies, and smite the hindmost of them; suffer them not to enter into their cities: for the LORD your God hath delivered them into your hand.
verses.ct: But don't stop yourselves! Keep chasing your enemies and cut off their rear forces. Don't let them reach their cities, because the LORD your God has given you victory over them."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of slaying them with a very great slaughter, till they were consumed, that the rest which remained of them entered into fenced cities.
verses.ct: After Joshua and the Israelites had finished inflicting a massive defeat on them, wiping out nearly all of them, the survivors managed to escape into their fortified cities.

verses.kjv: And all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace: none moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The entire army returned safely to Joshua at the camp in Makkedah. No one dared to say a word against any of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: Then said Joshua, Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out those five kings unto me out of the cave.
verses.ct: Then Joshua gave the order, "Open up the entrance of the cave and bring those 5 kings out to me."

verses.kjv: And they did so, and brought forth those five kings unto him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
verses.ct: They did so, bringing the 5 kings out of the cave to him: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they brought out those kings unto Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said unto the captains of the men of war which went with him, Come near, put your feet upon the necks of these kings. And they came near, and put their feet upon the necks of them.
verses.ct: Once the kings were brought before Joshua, he summoned all the men of Israel and told the military commanders who had gone with him, "Come forward and place your feet on the necks of these kings." So they stepped forward and put their feet on their necks.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto them, Fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong and of good courage: for thus shall the LORD do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.
verses.ct: Joshua told them, "Don't be afraid or discouraged. Be strong and courageous, because this is what the LORD will do to every enemy you fight against."

verses.kjv: And afterward Joshua smote them, and slew them, and hanged them on five trees: and they were hanging upon the trees until the evening.
verses.ct: After that, Joshua struck them down and killed them, then hung their bodies on 5 trees, where they remained until evening.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time of the going down of the sun, that Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and cast them into the cave wherein they had been hid, and laid great stones in the cave’s mouth, which remain until this very day.
verses.ct: At sunset, Joshua gave the command, and they took the bodies down from the trees and threw them into the cave where the kings had hidden. They placed large stones over the cave entrance, and those stones are still there to this day.

verses.kjv: And that day Joshua took Makkedah, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof he utterly destroyed, them, and all the souls that were therein; he let none remain: and he did to the king of Makkedah as he did unto the king of Jericho.
verses.ct: That same day Joshua captured Makkedah and put it to the sword, completely destroying its king and every person in it. He left no survivors. He treated the king of Makkedah the same way he had treated the king of Jericho.

verses.kjv: Then Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, unto Libnah, and fought against Libnah:
verses.ct: From Makkedah, Joshua and all Israel moved on to Libnah and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered it also, and the king thereof, into the hand of Israel; and he smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein; he let none remain in it; but did unto the king thereof as he did unto the king of Jericho.
verses.ct: The LORD also handed it and its king over to Israel. Joshua put it to the sword along with every person in it, leaving no survivors. He treated its king the same way he had treated the king of Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Joshua passed from Libnah, and all Israel with him, unto Lachish, and encamped against it, and fought against it:
verses.ct: From Libnah, Joshua and all Israel advanced to Lachish, where they set up camp and launched an attack.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel, which took it on the second day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein, according to all that he had done to Libnah.
verses.ct: The LORD handed Lachish over to Israel. They captured it on the 2nd day and put it to the sword, killing every person in it, just as they had done to Libnah.

verses.kjv: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish; and Joshua smote him and his people, until he had left him none remaining.
verses.ct: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish, but Joshua defeated him and his army, leaving no survivors.

verses.kjv: And from Lachish Joshua passed unto Eglon, and all Israel with him; and they encamped against it, and fought against it:
verses.ct: From Lachish, Joshua and all Israel moved on to Eglon, where they set up camp and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And they took it on that day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein he utterly destroyed that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
verses.ct: They captured it that same day and put it to the sword, completely destroying every person in it that day, just as they had done to Lachish.

verses.kjv: And Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him, unto Hebron; and they fought against it:
verses.ct: From Eglon, Joshua and all Israel advanced to Hebron and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And they took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof, and all the souls that were therein; he left none remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon; but destroyed it utterly, and all the souls that were therein.
verses.ct: They captured it and put it to the sword — its king, all its surrounding towns, and every person in it. He left no survivors, just as he had done to Eglon. He completely destroyed it and everyone in it.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to Debir; and fought against it:
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel turned back to Debir and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And he took it, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof; and they smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls that were therein; he left none remaining: as he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to the king thereof; as he had done also to Libnah, and to her king.
verses.ct: He captured it along with its king and all its surrounding towns. They put them to the sword and completely destroyed every person in it, leaving no survivors. What he had done to Hebron and to Libnah and its king, he also did to Debir and its king.

verses.kjv: So Joshua smote all the country of the hills, and of the south, and of the vale, and of the springs, and all their kings: he left none remaining, but utterly destroyed all that breathed, as the LORD God of Israel commanded.
verses.ct: So Joshua conquered the entire region — the hill country, the Negev, the western foothills, and the mountain slopes — along with all their kings. He left no survivors but completely destroyed everything that breathed, just as the LORD God of Israel had commanded.

verses.kjv: And Joshua smote them from Kadeshbarnea even unto Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even unto Gibeon.
verses.ct: Joshua conquered the territory from Kadeshbarnea all the way to Gaza, and the entire region of Goshen up to Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And all these kings and their land did Joshua take at one time, because the LORD God of Israel fought for Israel.
verses.ct: Joshua captured all these kings and their territories in a single campaign, because the LORD God of Israel was fighting for Israel.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
